alert.note: Alert for Watauga; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 4:08AM EDT until June 20 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory for Watauga and southwestern Wilkes Counties... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Watauga and Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams likely over the next few hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving north from Caldwell and Avery counties. Flooding of poor drainage and low-lying flood prone areas is likely over the next several hours. Rapid rises on small creeks and streams are likely. Some locations that could experience flooding Boone, Deep Gap, and Beech Mountain. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen already. - Boone, Deep Gap, Beech Mountain is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Beech Creek, Brushy Fork, Dutch Creek, Elk Creek, Cove Creek, Craborchard Creek, Beaverdam Creek and Dugger Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boone... Blowing Rock... Beech Mountain... Todd... Foscoe... Sugar Grove... Deep Gap... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
